verbs.description: [ARG0: The president and the king of gossip] [V: have] [ARG1: a relationship that ’s paid off for them both . Never more so than when Trump almost lost the election] .
The president and the king of gossip have a relationship that [V: ’s] paid off for them both . Never more so than when Trump almost lost the election .
The president and the king of gossip have [ARG1: a relationship] [R-ARG1: that] ’s [V: paid] off [ARG2: for them both] . Never more so than when Trump almost lost the election .
The president and the king of gossip have a relationship that ’s paid off for them both . Never more so than [ARGM-TMP: when] [ARG0: Trump] [ARGM-ADV: almost] [V: lost] [ARG1: the election] .
